fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
If we take a look at the installation steps of our documentation for *Connect to your database* section, it mentions that we need to download the Oracle JDBC Driver where it is already bundled with JIRA in _JIRA Install/lib/ojdbcx.x_. The step would be required for MySQL since it is not bundled but it should not be needed for Oracle.

This is mentioned in the documentation to install JIRA beside the Evaluation:
- [Installing JIRA Application on Linux|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/installing-jira-applications-on-linux-938846841.html]
- [Installing JIRA using Archive File|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/installing-jira-applications-on-linux-from-archive-file-938846844.html]
- [Installing JIRA Applications on Windows|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/installing-jira-applications-on-windows-938846835.html]

If we take a look at the documentation in connecting JIRA to Oracle below, this step is not included as well:
- [Connecting JIRA Applications to Oracle|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/connecting-jira-applications-to-oracle-938846856.html]

h3. Suggested Solution:
- Remove Oracle from the section as the driver is bundled.
fields.summary: JIRA Installation Documentation - Connect Database Review

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*
JIRA tickets are commonly worked on by a different assignee at a different stage of the workflow. It would be good to be able to easily see who've worked on the ticket before.

Currently, the user could potentially append the value from assignee field to a container field whenever a transition is done. However, if the assignee does not change, there could potentially be duplicate values here.

*Suggested Solution*
Include a feature which allows for listing of all past assignee + current assignee.

*Why this is important*
* Makes it more convenient for end of day reporting.
fields.summary: Track all current and past assignee for a ticket

fields.description:
h3. +Summary+

If a user has Link Issues permission in Jira instance A, but not in Jira instance B, he/she experiences unexpected behaviors when trying to link an issue from instance A to another one in instance B.
h3. +Steps to reproduce+
 # Link 2 Jira instances together e.g. 1 Software instance and 1 SD instance
 # Ensure user A has accounts in both instances with the same username
 # Ensure user A is a developer that has Link Issues permission in Software, but is a customer that only has Portal access to the SD instance
 # As user A, open an issue in Software and attempt to link it to another issue in SD

h3. +Expected behavior+

User A should be informed that he is not allowed to link issues to the SD instance
h3. +Actual behaviors+
 # User A is not able to search for issues in SD. Jira throws a 500 error invisible to the user (can be seen from F12 devtools only):
!link.png|thumbnail!
 # If user A enters a valid issue key from SD and clicks Link, he/she gets an error page with this stacktrace:
{code}
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at net.oauth.signature.OAuthSignatureMethod.normalizeUrl(OAuthSignatureMethod.java:161) [?:?]
	at net.oauth.signature.OAuthSignatureMethod.getBaseString(OAuthSignatureMethod.java:155) [?:?]
	at net.oauth.signature.OAuthSignatureMethod.getSignature(OAuthSignatureMethod.java:81) [?:?]
	at net.oauth.signature.OAuthSignatureMethod.sign(OAuthSignatureMethod.java:53) [?:?]
{code}

h3. +Notes+

* If the applinks do not use Impersonation, user A is also asked to log in and approve, which will then take him/her to the Portal of the SD instance. He/she still cannot link issues.
* Sometimes clicking the arrow button on the Issue search box shows a history search of issues in the Software instance, which is not expected as the SD instance is being selected for issue linking.
fields.summary: Unexpected behaviors when linking issues remotely

fields.description:
As an administrator of JIRA, I would like to be able to send an email to the Project Leads, and additionally be able to select the projects from whom the Project Leads would be selected.

We are currently using Jira Server Data Center v7.3.6.

In the Administration > System > Mail area is the Send Mail function that allows sending an email to end users based on selecting from a list of projects and selecting Project Roles to specify the mail recipients.

Project Lead is not in the list of Roles.

I'd like to see Project Lead available as a recipient.
fields.summary: Add "Project Leads" to roles list in System "Send Mail" function

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If there's a node starting up while the license is updated in another node, the node starting up will not update its license.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have 2 Jira Data Center nodes running
# Be ready to change the license on *node1* while *node2* is starting up
# As soon as the message {{You can now access JIRA through your web browser}} shows up in the logs for *node2*, click *Update license* in *node1*

h3. Expected Results
Both nodes will have the updated license.

h3. Actual Results
*node2* will start up with an outdated license.
 
h3. Notes
As this might be a race condition, this can be difficult to reproduce.

h3.Workaround
Restart the node with the outdated license.
fields.summary: Data Center node will keep the old license if it is starting while the license is updated in a different node

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a filename containing characters not supported by JIRA the file is not attached
It would be helpful if JIRA could rename the invalid characters into supported characters and attach the file instead of dropping it.

This issue is also impacting mail handlers where the email contains a file containing invalid characters in the file name.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create an issue.
# Attempt to attach a file with name "test/test.txt"


h3. Actual Results

The upload fails with the error "Upload failed"

h3. Suggestion for this feature

JIRA should rename the invalid characters into supported characters and attach the file instead of dropping it.
fields.summary: When a filename containing characters not supported by JIRA the file is not attached

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to upload an empty file as an attachment for issue, an error message will prompt "No data was sent for <file-name>. The browser may not be able to read the file."

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.4.2

h3. Expected Results
Able to upload the attachment

h3. Actual Results
Cannot upload the attachment. Error message prompts

h3.Workaround
Create zip file of the empty file, then upload as attachment (Technically file is not so empty anymore).
fields.summary: Cannot upload empty file as attachments

fields.description:
h3. Summary  
After importing bugs from Bugzilla, Original Estimate and Remaining Estimate rounded to full smaller hour (eg. 3.5 hours becomes 3 hours, 0.9 hours becomes 0)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Do an import of Bugzilla bugs (together with work logs) with External System Import. The file should contain Original Estimate and Remaining Estimate hours in decimal format (eg. 3.5 hours, 0.9 hours)

h3. Expected Results
All work logs are imported and contain correct values for Original and Remaining Estimate fields.

h3. Actual Results
* Imported work logs contain incorrect values for Original and Remaining Estimate fields (rounded to smaller whole hour).
* Work logs that end with rounded values to 0 hours don't get imported.

h3.Workaround
Import the work logs using CSV import with work log times stated in seconds.
fields.summary: Original Estimate and Remaining Estimate rounded while importing from Bugzilla

fields.description:
For adding a new comment, the Comment button and its corresponding form should be displayed according to the ordering (implemented in JRASERVER-3454), i.e:
 * after the comments, when ordering is oldest to newest
 * before the comments, when ordering is newest to oldest

Currently, the form is always displayed after, so it is very confusing when ordering is newest to oldest: you see the oldest comment and have the impression you reply to that. Yet, most of the times, a comment is related to the newest (latest) comment.

A good example for this behavior is the Facebook comments section.
fields.summary: Add-comment form should respect comment ordering

fields.description:
Hi,

Is there some way that if the specific field is marked for 'Yes' then we will automatically require some other fields to fill in when creating a Jira ticket?

Here are what I have tried:
 # I can set some fields to be required to fill in for any issues in JIRA. But I can't set some fields to be required according to the value of another field in "Field Configuration".
 # I tried to add some fields in Workflow -> Transition. The "Create" transition has no "Condition", and only has "Validations". It can't meet my requirements.

Any suggestion and workaround are welcome!

Thanks in advance!

-Maggie
fields.summary: Automatically required some other fields refer to specific field when creating ticket

fields.description:
**Problem Experienced**

IE11: In Visual Mode of Issue Description, Typing Left square brace, “some text”, Right brace will delete inside text

 

**Environment:**

Windows - Internet Explorer 11

 

*Steps to Repro:*
 # Use IE11 within windows environment
 # Create Issue
 # Within description type [ then some text and then add the ]
 # Observe the only remaining character is the right square brace

 

**Expected Result:**

Text would persist within block.

 

**Actual Result:**

Text (including left square brace) is removed once the right square brace is applied. Video has been included in attachments.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6.4.1
* Jira 7.5.0

* create two tickets on Jira (TICKET-01, TICKET-02)
* create an epic on Jira (EPIC-01)
* assign one of the tickets (TICKET-01) to the epic

* go to Confluence, use and configure Jira Issue Macro to filter both tickets

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a user navigates to JIRA during a foreground re-index, the johnson page shows the "JIRA had problems starting up" title which is misleading.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Perform a foreground reindex by selecting the "Lock JIRA and rebuild index" option from the reindexing options.
 # Another user accesses JIRA during rebuild index
 # The page will show the "JIRA had problems starting up" title.

h3. Expected Results

The page shows a title the clearly indicates that JIRA is re-indexing.

h3. Actual Results

The page shows the "JIRA had problems starting up" title.
 !Capture.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: When a user navigates to JIRA during a foreground re-index, the Johnson page shows a misleading title

fields.description:
3. Summary
Untitled Epics changed to Stories still require an Epic title


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a Story
# Click Edit
# Change Issue Type to Epic
# Save
# Open that Epic
# Click Edit
# Change Epic to Story
# Click Update


h3. Expected Results
Epic gets converted to Story whether or not there was an Epic title

h3. Actual Results
Cannot Update the Issue and get the error message 'Epic Name is required.'

h3.Workaround
Change the Issue Type from the drop-down list in the Details view of the Epic.
fields.summary: Untitled Epics changed to Stories still require an Epic title

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*
Currently, after updating to JIRA 7.5.2, users are no longer able to export the maximum limit of issues allowed (1000) when the JQL returns more than 1000 issues. User are hitting into 403 error on browser.

Further investigation found that in 7.5.2 and newer, JIRA has dropped the use of the &tempMax=1000 by default, and thus would throw the 403 forbidden error.

Previous versions such as 7.5.0 allow the export.

*Suggested Solution*
Allow the export, but notify the user that only a limited number of issues are exported.

*Why this is important*
This would make it more convenient for the users to export their issue. Current problem of hitting into the 403 browser error makes it not possible for user to perform the export. The workaround which is to append "&tempMax=1000" at the end of export URL would not be intuitive enough.
fields.summary: Allow export of first 1000 issues seen in Issue Navigator

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, it is possible to create an issue remotely by triggering a direct HTML link that has all the fields parameters and values inlcuded in the URL like below:
- [Creating Issues via direct HTML links|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/creating-issues-via-direct-html-links-159474.html]

But, at the moment, it is required for the URL to include at least the Project ID and Issue Type ID to make it work else, the Project/Issue Type field would not have any value and it is not selectable after it. Hence, it is required for the user to know each Project ID and Issue Type ID for each call. This is not user-friendly for users that do not have know the IDs

h3. Suggested Solution:
At the "CreateIssue.jspa" it is possible to select the Project and Issue Type while it is not possible to add the rest of the fields if using this page instead. Hence, it will be great if there is an option include more fields into this page hence, the user can pre-populated fields by putting the parameter in the URL while when redirected, it is still possible to select the Project or Issue Type.
fields.summary: Option to include more fields to "CreateIssue.jspa" page

fields.description:
Hi,

I am trying to clone only my subtasks from 1 JIRA. Objective is to clone a set of common tasks for my team and move them to another JIRA.

One way is to create common subtasks in one dummy JIRA and have the JIRA issue itself cloned along with all the sybtasks created in it. But this will unnecessarily create one extra story and i have to constantly have the cloned JIRA deleted. 

Is there any way to avoid creation of extra JIRAs to have only my subtasks cloned in bulk?

 

Thanks and Regards,

Bhuwanesh
fields.summary: Bulk Cloning only my Subtasks in one JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Based on our documentation at [Performing Test Searches|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/performing-text-searches-720416596.html#PerformingTextSearches-Reservedwords], "a", and "s" are all reserved words and cannot be searched using a JQL which looks like {{summary ~ a}}

h3. Expected results
Searching for {{summary ~ s}} returns no results.

h3. Actual results
Searching for {{summary ~ s}} is able to return some results.
fields.summary: Update Reserved Words section for JQL Searching KB

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When new priority is created, it will automatically be added into the default priority scheme. This will be an issue when the default priority scheme has been used by many projects and users do not want the new priority scheme to be included in those projects. 

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be useful to have the ability to edit the default priority scheme and remove the newly created priority. 

Alternatively, removing the auto-adding of newly created priority scheme may be useful too.

h3. Workaround 
# Create a new priority scheme
# Add all the priorities of the initial default priority scheme
# Associate all the affected projects with the scheme

(i) Need to actively associate new projects with this scheme
fields.summary: Provide the ability to edit the default priority scheme

fields.description: I just rebuilt my jira, and can't seem to figure out how to get the traditional project + issue types, i.e. story, epic, bug, etc... What has changed?
fields.summary: Only 2 issue types?

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you start by viewing Project A and attempt to create an issue in Project A, the default priority that is specified in the priority scheme is enforced correctly, and vice-versa for viewing Project B and attempting to create an issue in Project B.  But, if you have a Default Priority scheme set on the two different projects and create an issue while in project A then switch to project B while on the create issue screen the Default priority from project A is applied to the issue being created in project B, and The priority scheme for project B is ignored.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 projects
# Create 2 Priority Schemes 
#* associate each scheme to one of the projects
#* Set Highest priority as default on one and lowest on the other EXE:
!Screen Shot 2018-09-26 at 11.45.02 AM.png|thumbnail!
# Navigate to Project A and select Create to trigger create issue screen Note the Default priority is set to Lowest:
!Screen Shot 2018-09-26 at 12.01.24 PM.png|thumbnail!
# Use the project drop down to Switch to Project B

h3. Expected Results
Default Priority is set to the Default value per the scheme

h3. Actual Results
The Default value from Project A is left behind, in the EXE priority should be Highest but is set to Lowest:
!Screen Shot 2018-09-26 at 12.00.05 PM.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes
- Navigate to project B and create an issue the value will be set to project B's default value
- This seems to happen in the Create Issue popup only. 

h3. Workaround
- Manual verification is the only current validation method
- Under some circumstances where this has to be avoided completely, we can disable the Create Issue popup by following this KB: [How to disable Create Issue popup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-disable-create-issue-popup-300813780.html]. The method, "Disable via Javascript" is the easiest to apply in this case where it will force the issue creation in a full page instead of a popup.
fields.summary: When Changing To a Different Project in Issue create Default priority is not selected

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Plugins/apps with expired maintenance terms can still be updated to newer versions.

After investigation (on Jira 7.5 and latest UPM version), we’ve got to the conclusion that Jira caches the status of the licenses and does not clear this cache when add-ons are upgraded/disabled/enabled.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Given:
* Version A of our add-on, released on 2017-07-07
* A commercial license with support expiring on 2017-08-26
* Version B of our add-on, released on 2017-11-17

# install version A of the add-on
# apply the commercial license: add-on works correctly (OK)
# upgrade the add-on to the version B: add-on still works correctly  (NOK. The license maintenance expired before the release of version B, there should have been an error LicenseError.VERSION_MISMATCH)

h3. Expected Results
The license maintenance expired before the release of version B, there should have been an error {{LicenseError.VERSION_MISMATCH}}. (See [docs|https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/marketplace/server-app-license-validation-rules/])

h3. Actual Results
You can upgrade the app even if the maintenance of you license has expired and the new version of the app has been released after the maintenance expiration date.

h3. Notes
* If we simply disable/enable the add-on, then the license works as if it was valid (cache not cleared, pluginLicense.isValid() returns true) and this is not ok.
* If we restart the Jira instance, then Jira detects the invalid license and everything is handled correctly (meaning the add-on does not work anymore, pluginLicense.isValid() returns false).
* Or, if in our add-on we do, during startup:
eventPublisher.publish(new ClearCacheEvent(Collections.emptyMap()));
all the caches are cleared and the add-on detects correctly that the license is invalid (pluginLicense.isValid() returns false).

I believe every marketplace vendor uses the same api for license check. The way this work I believe it's possible to upgrade any add-on even if the maintenance is expired and the release date of the new version is after the maintenance expiration date. So I think this impacts all the server vendors.

We have also reported this on the developer community: https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/jira-license-licensemanager-cache-is-not-cleared-when-the-add-ons-are-upgraded-disabled-enabled/13372
fields.summary: Jira License/LicenseManager cache is not cleared when the add-ons are upgraded/disabled/enabled

fields.description:
With the introduction of the Kanban Backlog in Jira v7.6.1, some of our users are limited by the fact that once a status is added to the backlog, it can no longer be displayed within one of the columns of the Kanban board.

We see the backlog as an area for organizing work that is not yet ready to be implemented. Our users would like to be able to use this _along with_ the first column of the Kanban board to prioritize work that is ready to be done but has not started.

Adding the ability to view the first status of the workflow in both the first column of the Kanban board and the Kanban backlog seems like a much cleaner approach than cluttering up the workflows with an additional state that is used strictly for this use case.
fields.summary: Allow status in both Kanban Backlog and "To Do" column

fields.description:
As a product manager, I use epics and epic colors to organize groups of cards. The colors by epic are great because my team and I can see at a high level where we are at with a group of features & set goals with something easy to remember (ex- finish all the purple cards in the sprint by the end of the week). Our team deploys continuously, so setting a sprint's worth of work is not relevant for us.

 

My request is to have the colors update in real-time. I just updated the colors and it took about 5-10 minutes for the colors to reflect.
fields.summary: Epic Color Update

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Software Data Center quick start template (https://aws.amazon.com/quickstart/architecture/jira/) on AWS fails to properly enable clustering on the created instance. 

h3. Environment
AWS

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Set up JDC on AWS following cloud formation template provided from https://aws.amazon.com/quickstart/architecture/jira

h3. Expected Results
A cluster.properties file is created in the local Jira home and a functional JDC cluster is started up after deployment

h3. Actual Results
* No cluster.properties file was generated in the local JIRA home
* Clustering is disabled in deployed instance

h3.Workaround
Manually setup cluster.properties file as outlined in [Configure your existing JIRA instance to work in a cluster|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/installing-jira-data-center-828787580.html#InstallingJIRADataCenter-3.ConfigureyourexistingJIRAinstancetoworkinacluster].
fields.summary: AWS JIRA Data Center quick start template - clustering is not enabled

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On a fresh installation of Jira, the default columns are greatly reduced (compared to an upgrade of the same version)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Perform a fresh installation of Jira
 # Create a sample project (with a key of {{TEST}}
 # Click Issues » Search for Issues, and enter some JQL (as {{PROJECT = TEST}})
 # Swap the issue navigator to "List View"

h3. Expected Results

At a minimum, the default columns of the issue navigator should be shown:
{code:java}
Issue Type, Key, Summary, Assignee, Reporter, Priority, Status, Resolution, Created, Updated, Due date
{code}
h3. Actual Results

The default columns of the issue navigator are shown:
{code:java}
Key, Status, Created, Updated, Development
{code}
h3. Workaround

The only workaround at this time is to manually adjust the columns - either for yourself [or by editing the system setting |https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-the-default-issue-navigator-938847005.html] for all users.
h3. Notes
 * The "Development" column is a new column as mentioned in the [release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-7-7-x-release-notes-941594462.html]. -
 * This problem only affects fresh installations of Jira - the problem rises from an upgrade task that's run at a point where there's no projects in the system.
 * This shouldn't affect upgrades, as the data should be in the system by the time the upgrade task is run
 * This issue cannot be replicated by running Jira Server via {{atlas-run-standalone}}.
fields.summary: Default columns of issue navigator changed in Jira 7.7.0

fields.description:
*Reported Support Ticket*
 GHS-99821

Summary of Support Ticket:

User reported that after upgrading from version 6.X to 7.2 (Upgrade path was correct.) that the timezone of a given user when hovered over would display as the timezone of the viewing user.

IE: I am in Texas and looking at a user in California, they hover profile would still show CST as the timezone.

Add-ons do not seem to be the cause. 

User took at look at their plugins for us and it looks correct.
{quote}*JIRA Time Zone Detection plugin (6/6 modules)*
 Time zone detection filter (tzdetect-filter)*
 Time zone detection JavaScript resources (tzdetect-lib)
 Time zone detection user profile clicker (tzdetect-userprofile)
 Time zone detection REST module (tzdetect-rest)
 Time zone detection analytics whitelist (tzdetect-analytics-whitelist)
 Rest Servlet Filter (tzdetect-rest-filter)

*Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - User Profile Plugin*
 custom-user-details
 custom-user-prefs
 custom-user-assigned
 user-details-resources
{quote}
 

*Steps to replicate:*

 

Add a user as a participant to a ticket from a different timezone than the logged in user. Hover over their username and their profile will popup with the incorrect timezone.

I was able to replicate this issue in the support environment. Will upload screenshot shortly.

 

!Screenshot_20180112_105701.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Hover Profile Displays Incorrect Timezone

fields.description:
1) provide export to excel or csv

2) provide a toggle to "Show more" for all userids on the page - currently you have to click "Show more" for every single userid

Trying to do manage a restricted number of licenses involves filtering on multiple groups, e.g., you need to know which part of the organization each licensee is in, as well as which group they're licensed under. You can't do this on the User management page, so:

*{color:#FF0000}(1){color}* exporting to excel would be a good way to let people analyze their user base. 

In Jira 6.4, you could at least copy and paste the user list with all their groups into excel and filter.  In Jira 7.5, you've added a "Show more" button for each user if they are in more than 5 groups. This means you have to click "Show more" for every such user. *{color:#FF0000}(2){color}* {color:#333333}If you could toggle "Show more" for the entire page, that would save considerable time.{color}
fields.summary: Possible Improvements to the User Management Page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Plan variables passed from Jira to Bamboo; One variable will be set to 'undefined' as the variable name instead of properly overrighting the variable value as expected.

When sending from Jira to Bamboo:
variable = xyz
cvariable = abc

Bamboo receives
variable = xyz
undefined = abc
h3. Environment
 * Bamboo
 * Jira Server
 ** Unknown if the bug affects Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a build plan with at least one Build linked to a Jira issue
 # Add the 4 variables above as Plan variables
 # Enable DEBUG logging in Jira
 # Create a Version in Jira
 # Release the version, overriding the variables:
{noformat}
testing : bam
gtesting : boo
foobar : foobar
testingh  : test{noformat}

h3. Expected Results

variables set in Jira release sent properly to Bamboo
h3. Actual Results

The below is shown in the logs:
{noformat:title=jira HTTP Log}
2017-12-15 20:24:24,009 http-nio-9080-exec-5 DEBUG admin 1224x1133x1 d5y7ix 127.0.0.1 /secure/SubmitBambooRelease.jspa [o.apache.http.wire] http-outgoing-86 >> "bamboo.triggerReason.jiraProjectName=Elias+Test&bamboo.triggerReason.jiraVersion=v4&bamboo.variable.foobar=foobar&bamboo.variable.undefined=boo&bamboo.variable.testingh=test&bamboo.triggerReason.jiraUsername=admin&bamboo.triggerReason.jiraProjectKey=ET&bamboo.triggerReason.jiraBaseUrl=http%3A%2F%2F<bamboo-url>%3A9080&bamboo.variable.testing=bam&bamboo.triggerReason.jiraVersionId=10003&bamboo.triggerReason.jiraUserDisplayName=Elias+Zeidan&bamboo.customTriggerReasonKey=com.atlassian.bamboo.plugin.jira%3AjiraReleaseTriggerReason&bamboo.customPlanTriggerKey=com.atlassian.bamboo.plugin.jira%3AjiraReleasePlanTrigger"
{noformat}
{noformat:title=Bamboo Build Log}
Custom variables
Name	Value
jira.projectKey	ET
jira.version	v3
foobar	foobar
jira.projectName	Elias Test
testingh	test
testing	bam
jira.username	admin
jira.baseUrl	<jira-url>
undefined	boo
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently the only workaround is to change the variable names to be dissimilar from each other.
fields.summary: environment variable name being set to 'undefined' when passed from Jira to Bamboo under certain cercumstances

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA uses activeobjects (AO) library and before7.4, AO uses _NTEXT_ column type for MSSQL. After that is uses _NVARCHAR(max)_
 Before 7.4: activeobjects-plugin-1.2.3.jar
 After 7.4: activeobjects-plugin-1.4.0.jar
h3. Environment
 * JIRA 7.4+
 * MSSQL

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install JIRA 7.2
 # Upgrade to 7.4

h3. Expected Results

_NTEXT_ columns should be migrated correctly to NVARCHAR columns.
h3. Actual Results

_NTEXT_ columns are still the same columns after the upgrading.
h3. Notes
 * NTEXT deprecated for over 10 years, since SqlServer2005 and while still present in SqlServer2016, it will be removed later. According to Microsoft documentation: [ntext, text, and image (Transact-SQL)|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/t-sql/data-types/ntext-text-and-image-transact-sql?view=sql-server-ver15]

{quote}IMPORTANT! ntext, text, and image data types will be removed in a future version of SQL Server. Avoid using these data types in new development work, and plan to modify applications that currently use them. Use nvarchar(max), varchar(max), and varbinary(max) instead.
{quote}
h3. Workaround
 * Manually update all columns in tables AO_% from ntext to nvarchar(max)
fields.summary: NTEXT columns in AO_xxx tables on SQL Server are not migrated automatically to NVARCHAR columns when upgrading to 7.4

fields.description:
h3. Definition
Project import from XML backup is not like regular creation of issues - post functions on Create transition should be skipped (and also conditions and validators) or if you think that some customers may want to run the post-functions, then make it configurable.


h3. Suggestion
Have the option to configure whether the workflow condition, validator and postfunctions are to be reflected when running a project import.
fields.summary: Project Import Should Skip any Workflow Postfunction, Condition and Validator

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As an admin, there isn’t a way to tell whether third-party add-ons are being used, only if they are installed.

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a way to track this through the UPM to show if the functionality is being currently used.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like a way to track which add-ons are being used

fields.description:
Summary
 # When there is additional "unresolved" resolution added in JIRA, Pie Chart gadget will show 2 unresolved labels which are:-
 ** System Default - Unresolved
 ** JIRA Admin added - Unresolved
 # As per expected both were showing different statistic if we different numbers of tickets to different unresolved resolution.
 # For example we assign 25 ticket for System Default - Unresolved, and 5 ticket to JIRA Admin added - Unresolved.
 # Pie Chart were able to show 2 different unresolved with 25 tickets and 5 tickets.
 # When we click on the system default unresolved label with 25 ticket assigned in Pie Chart, it shows JQL Query below:-
{code}
component is EMPTY AND resolution is EMPTY\
{code}
# When we click on the JIRA Admin added - Unresolved with 5 ticket assigned in Pie Chart, it shows JQL Query Below:-
{code}
component is EMPTY AND resolution = Unresolved\
{code}

 # (i) Both JQL query were showing same result when we search for issue with these query but Pie Chart showing correct statistic

Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a "Unresolved" resolution in resolution setting
 # Create 1 issue and assign with "Unresolved" resolution created by JIRA Admin
 (i) Go to ticket > edit resolution > assign it with unresolved resolution
 # Create 5 issues and these ticket are unresolved by default
 # Create a filter with "component is EMPTY"
 # Add a Pie Chart Gadget in Dashboard and assign the filter created in previous step
 # There will be 2 resolution shows with 5 issues and 1 issue statistic.
 # Click on both unresolved label, and both will showing JQL Query with results showing 5 issues
 # Supposedly, one of the JQL should show 1 issue

Actual Results
 Both unresolved label, are using different JQL Query with results showing 5 issues

Expected Results
 Supposedly, one of the JQL should show 1 issue

Workarounds
 * Do not Use a resolution called 'Unresolved'

 * Use the resolution = "\"Unresolved\"" instead of resolution = Unresolved to force JQL to search for the value 'Unresolved' rather than the issues without a resolution set. This will only work when saving a filter, as dynamically generated JQL (like the one generated on each issue count from the gadgets) will still have the issue.

Notes:
* This looks like a limitation in JQL, but what is not expected is that gadgets would do the search in a different way than how you as a user are able to use JQL. Basically we have the behavior when searching as a user: the JQL using *resolution = Unresolved* will prioritize searching for issues without a resolution. On the other hand, when gadgets use the filter with *resolution = Unresolved* they will actually search prioritizing issues with a resolution with the value 'Unresolved' rather than not having a resolution set and when a user clicks in a link that redirects to the issue navigator, the 'JQL for user' behavior kicks in, showing a different number of issues than what the number in the gadgets indicates.
fields.summary: Pie Chart and Two-Dimensional gadgets showing wrong JQL data when using 'Unresolved' resolution

fields.description:
Hi,

Starting from May 2018 EU companies should follow the restrictions described in GDPR (General data Protection regulation). For us, as a big company, it means that project managers should have access only to their projects. But since Jira allows customization of projects only with global Jira-admin role, we need to have some workaround in this situation. There are about 1500 users in our company and it's hard to administer all existing projects, instead of allowing managers to do it themselves.

Could you please let us know if you plan to modify Jira correspondingly soon? Or maybe you could advise on which plug-ins can be used in order to give managers access to customize their own projects? We tested Delegated Project Admin plug-in, but it doesn't cover our needs.

We added corresponding suggestions in the comments under this case as well: JRASERVER-65574 .

Thank you,

Best regards,

Nataliia Positko
fields.summary: GDPR data protection - JIRA project administration
Allow Configuration of the Number of Workflow Transition Buttons per project, and from the UI

fields.description: We would like to be able to *create* new issues via the REST API without sending notifications, analogous to the option that now exists for updating issues via the REST API (JRASERVER-34423).  We have several standard issues (with sub-issues) that we create for each release cycle and ideally would like to create them without generating the usual notifications.
fields.summary: Add the ability to create issues via REST without sending notifications

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
See related ticket: JRASERVER-64974 
JIRA Datacenter (JDC) uses Ehcache as caching technology, cache server which exposes available cache operations remotely through RMI. Ehcache requires two ports for it's network operations:
* port - a port in the range 1025 - 65536
* remoteObjectPort - the port number on which the remote objects bound in the registry receive calls. This defaults to a free port if not specified.

Currently in JDC (7.3+) you can specify:
*  *port* (default = 40001, setting: ehcache.listener.port), see [Cluster.properties file parameters|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+JIRA+Data+Center#InstallingJIRADataCenter-Security]
* *remoteObjectPort* (default = _dynamic_, setting: ehcache.object.port)

So by default *remoteObjectPort* is dynamically allocated and [TCP ephemeral port|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ephemeral_port] is selected. So you need to open wide range of ports at firewall. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Set *ehcache.object.port* by default to 40011

h3. Implemented 
In the fixed version, it's required to open two ports for each node (see JRASERVER-68652)
* Ehcache port default _40001_
* Object port default _40011_

h3. Workaround 
Set *ehcache.object.port* manually
{panel:title=cluster.properties}
...
ehcache.object.port = 40011
{panel}
fields.summary: As an JIRA Datacenter Administrator I want use default ehcache RMI port

fields.description:
*Problem definition:*
The user needs to have the option to customise system notifications as done in the Customer notifications.

*Suggested Solution:*
Allow the ability to customise the system notifications.

*Workaround:*
Use the JIRA template for system notifications.
fields.summary: Customize System Notifications

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the REST API will strictly follow the rules of Jira. This includes the user will only be able to specify fields on the screen. However, the admin may need to specify values for fields via REST API which the users should not be able to specify either via create or edit screen. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Give the admin the ability to specify values for field which are not specified on the create/edit screen, so the users can only see this value, but not specify it.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like REST API to update fields that are not present on the create/edit screens

fields.description:
h5. Summary
When we have more than 150 custom field linked with the create screen and while creating an issue we choose Configure Field, the last two fields in the list are partially cut-off.

h5. Steps to replicate
 # Link more than 150 custom fields with a create screen in a project.
 # Try to create a issue in the same project
 # On the create screen click Configure Fields on the right top corner
 # You will see the last two fields are partially cut off.

h5. Expected results
All the fields name in the list should appear fully without being cut-off.

h5. Actual results
Bottom fields are partially cut-off

h5. Workaround
Hovering over the checkbox or the word at the bottom will show the full word, so it is readable.
fields.summary: Field List Cut off in the Configure Fields box on Create Screen

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary
 * Some Configurations are being cut off from Gadget when there is small size Gadget at the bottom which can not accommodate Configuration window. 

h5. Steps to Reproduce
 # Created one empty Dashboard and then added Gadgets to the dashboard
 # Created one Gadget at the bottom with no issues in it.
 # Click on Configuration Window.
 # Some options are getting cut off in top bottom gadget

h5. Expected Behavior
 * Configuration window should show all options regardless of Gadget size

h5. Actual Behavior
 * Some Options are getting cut of(not visible) when clicking on configuration window of top bottom gadget on either side.

h5. Note
* While reproducing this issue, found that if we place the Gadgets at the top bottom which are longer in size enough of configuration window then we can avoid this issue.
fields.summary: JIRA Dashboard options get cut off based on gadget placement

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary
 * When trying to create a sub-task while using the Czech locale, the date format provided by date pickers is incorrect.

h5. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add any date picker field to the sub-task screens (like Due Date).
 # Set the locale to čeština (Česká republika).
 # Create an issue.
 # From the view screen of that issue, click the button "More" and then _Create Sub-task_ (this problem is also present is using a List view on the issue navigator and clicking on the "..." button and using the option "Create Sub-task").
 # Once the sub-task creation screen appears, look for the date picker field and select a date.

h5. Expected Behavior
 * The date will appear in the format that JIRA is configured to use (usually the month name reduced to 3 letters).

h5. Actual Behavior
 * The Month appears indicated with roman numbers instead of with the 3 letters and the screen does not accept it as a valid date format. This does not happen in English locale. !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h5. Workarounds
 * After selecting the date, correct it manually by writing the correct 3 letters expected for the month instead of the roman number.
 * From the Backlog view, click on the issue and it will be shown on the right side, use any of these 2 options to create the sub-tasks, in that way, the date picker gives the correct date:   !image-2018-01-08-15-54-31-416.png|thumbnail! 
* Setting the a date format where months are indicated using numbers instead of letters by setting the following in *JIRA Administration > System,* option _General Configuration,_ button _Advanced Settings._ This will not fix the issue but at least the dates will be shown using regular numbers instead of roman ones:
** jira.date.picker.java.format = dd/MM/yyyy
** jira.date.picker.javascript.format = %e/%m/%y
fields.summary: Date format incorrect when creating sub-task in Czech language

fields.description: We utilize the Inherit From Parent functionality a bit in our instance. However, we would like to be able to extend this to Epics to Stories. From my understanding they are not linked/treated the same way Sub-tasks are with their Parent ticket.
fields.summary: Inherit From Parent Functionality for Epics to Stories

fields.description:
h3. Summary

During user login, user data is updated and membership is synchronised with remote LDAP (happens as part of _updateGroupsMembershipOnLogin_). If any new group is found it will be added to local Jira cache (DB). If new group name differs from existing by:
* a trailing space
* the use of lower and upper cases(e.g. "Group" & "GROUP")
* or have an accented character(e.g. ã, á, ü)
JIRA tries to create it but fails later due to conflict in DB: _Cannot insert duplicate key row.._ (see below). 

Since _updateGroupsMembershipOnLogin_ failed Jira *denies* user login.

h3. Environment
 * JIRA
 * Remote Ldap with 2 groups:
 ** 'Test Group ' (with space)
 ** 'Test Group'
 * User1 belongs to only one of the groups.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run directory sync and check that one of groups is present
 # Add user to another group (not the one present)
 # Login to JIRA

h3. Expected Results

JIRA should either:
 * Create another group (with or without space)
 * (Not-advisable) Normalise the groups, detect that groups are the same and skip the adding the group

h3. Actual Results
 * User not able to login to JIRA
 * Error in the log:

h3. Notes
 * Enabling logging for {{com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory}} will show the following attempt to create new group:
{noformat}
Group Test Group doesn't exist during authentication of user test@local.com, trying to create
{noformat}

 * Looks like there is misalignment in JIRA code in different abstraction levels:
 ** During login JIRA things groups are different
 ** Down the stack JIRA treats both groups as the same and that leads to unique index violation.

h3. Workaround

Rename other group to avoid name duplicate

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA DC might lose cluster lock while trying to unlock the lock if there is database connectivity problems .

That makes whole cluster stuck for some operations/actions that needs that lock.
 Specifically we saw problem with:
 * {{com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultReindexMessageManager.messageLock}} lock
 * {{com.atlassian.upm.impl.PluginManagerPluginAsynchronousTaskStatusStoreImpl}} lock
 * {{NotificationBatchScheduler.sd_batch_sending_lock}} lock
 * {{sla_issue_update_xx}} lock
 * the Service Desk Mail Puller job {{com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.services.MailPullerJobRunner}}

So there is a possible chain of events:
 # Node1 obtains the lock in *thread1*
 ** Node1 registers it in DB and internal JVM structure.
 # All other nodes see lock and wait
 ** *Thread1* unlocks the lock. While updating db it fails and release only local ref lock
 # All other nodes see lock and wait
 # Lock check at Node1 see that local ref is NULL and DB lock is present, so does nothing
 # All stuck

h3. Environment
 * JIRA Datacenter

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up a Datacenter JIRA instance with 2 nodes
 # Initiate action that would obtain the lock
 # Break connection to the database while this node has a clusterlock and tries to unlock it

h3. Expected Results

JIRA will recover and do the unlock query once connected back to the database
h3. Actual Results

JIRA DC lost the cluster lock. The below exception is thrown in the {{atlassian-jira.log}} file:

Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:UPDATE clusterlockstatus SET  UPDATE_TIME = ? ,  LOCKED_BY_NODE = ?  WHERE LOCK_NAME=? AND LOCKED_BY_NODE=? 
(Communications link failure: 
The last packet successfully received from the server was 1,339,594 milliseconds ago.  The last packet sent successfully to the server was 0 milliseconds ago.)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.bulkUpdateByAnd(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:570)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.WrappingOfBizDelegator.bulkUpdateByAnd(WrappingOfBizDelegator.java:290)
	at com.atlassian.jira.entity.Update$WhereContext.execute(Update.java:126)
	at com.atlassian.jira.entity.Update$WhereContext.execute(Update.java:122)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.lock.JiraClusterLockDao.unlock(JiraClusterLockDao.java:82)
	at com.atlassian.beehive.db.DatabaseClusterLock.unlock(DatabaseClusterLock.java:372)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultReindexMessageManager.getMessage(DefaultReindexMessageManager.java:190)
...
{noformat}
 
h3. Workaround

Restart the problematic node. See the following KB article for full instructions on this workaround:
 [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-data-center-functionalities-loss-due-to-cluster-wide-lock-942860754.html]
fields.summary: JIRA DC might lose Cluster lock due database connectivity problems

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In some situations JIRA DC have stale/lost cluster lock. Normally you can check this by navigating to *Cluster Locks* check [ System > Support Tools > Instance health > Cluster Locks ]. Problem that JIRA Admin space (mentioned check is under that space) uses lock {{com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultReindexMessageManager.messageLock}}, so if it's lost, than it's impossible to check the locks.  

h3. Suggested Solution
Create separate Cluster Status space which:
* will not use any lock to access it
* will show _all current Cluster locks_ with following data:
** Lock name - Node - Age
* (Advanced) will be able to break/steal Cluster lock 

h3. Workaround 
Check DB table {{clusterlockstatus}}:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
select * from clusterlockstatus where locked_by_node is not NULL;
{code}
fields.summary: JIRA Datacenter - Add Cluster lock status page which doesn't use locks

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Importing from Cloud to an empty Server instance fails producing an NullPointerException
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Export data from a cloud instance
 # Set up or access a test Server instance (7.6.2 is fine to reproduce)
 # Attempt to import the data

h3. Expected Results

The import works without problems
h3. Actual Results

The import stops at 90% and then fails producing an error. Tables appear to be partially generated during the process, so a new import requires deleting and recreating the application DB beforehand. If the import was made using the Setup Wizard during a fresh installation, the UI does not display any errors but users won't be able to login afterwards.

The below exception is thrown in the catalina.log file:
{noformat}
2018-01-03 16:49:56,678 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR admin 1009x287x1 6z8rud 172.21.44.34 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Error importing data: java.lang.NullPointerException
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsTableCreator.getTypeInfo(ActiveObjectsTableCreator.java:111)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsTableCreator.toDdlField(ActiveObjectsTableCreator.java:93)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsTableCreator.toDdlTable(ActiveObjectsTableCreator.java:83)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsTableCreator.create(ActiveObjectsTableCreator.java:70)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsTableCreator.create(ActiveObjectsTableCreator.java:57)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.TableDefinitionImporter.doImportNode(TableDefinitionImporter.java:50)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.AbstractImporter.importNode(AbstractImporter.java:44)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.DbImporter.importData(DbImporter.java:69)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsBackup.restore(ActiveObjectsBackup.java:151)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.restoreActiveObjects(.java:584)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.performImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:758)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.doImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:331)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:28)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:157)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:133)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
{noformat}
For some instances, this also causes errors related to some AO tables not existing like:
 * ERROR: relation "public.AO_21F425_MESSAGE_AO" does not exist
 * ERROR: relation "public.AO_E8B6CC_ORGANIZATION_MAPPING" does not exist

h3. Workaround

Manually removing all data relating to AO_575BF5 from activeobjects.xml allows the import to complete successfully:
 # Extract the contents of the backup (zip) file.
 # Using your preferred text editor, open the file _activeobjects.xml._
 # Look and delete all the tags containing a reference to the table _AO_575BF5._ You need to remove each complete entry related to it (see my example [^image-2018-01-04-19-26-39-993.png]. The example is using a different table, but the principle is the same. The XML file might appear in a format difficult to read, so you might want to do the following:
 ** For *Windows Users:* use a text editor that can format the XML to be humanly easier to read and edit, in my case I used Notepad++ with the [XML Tools plugin|https://sourceforge.net/projects/npp-plugins/files/XML%20Tools/], and used the function 'Pretty print' from the XML Plugin (see my example [^image-2018-01-04-19-12-05-438.png]).
 ** For *Unix based OS*, another option to format the XML file is with the command:
{noformat}
xmllint --format activeobjects.xml > activeobjects_formatted.xml
{noformat}
 *** (i) You will need to rename the _activeobjects_formatted.xml_ back to _activeobjects.xml_ before zipping them.
 # Once all the entries related to the table _AO_575BF5_ have been removed, save the file and create a new zip file using the newly saved _activeobjects.xml_ and the original entities.xml.
 # Attempt the Restore System again.

If a user changes his email address then send email notification to new email address with link to confirm the Email Address and then update that email address.Currently there is no verification of email address even if it does not exist.

User can put email address of anyone else who is not even aware about that his email address is being used.

fields.description:
h4. Summary
France translation gives wrong translation. It translates *1* as *11* for issue count in Backlog view, active sprint view and Kanban board view (swimlanes)

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Setup a board with swimlane that shows 1 issue in a swimlane (or create a sprint and associate 1 issue there)
# Change default language to France

h4. Expected Result
It will translate 1 issue as 1 demande

h4. Actual Result
It translates 1 issue as 11 demande
!france.png|thumbnail! 
!sprint.png|thumbnail!

*Note*
* Tested in all Chrome and Safari browsers
* Affecting Backlog view (issue count in sprint and backlog), Active sprint and Kanban view (swimlane issue count)

Especially on lists of projects it is not immediately obvious that there can be more than one page of results as the indicator is small and in the bottom right hand corner.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
"Empty spaces" are appended to comments when user switches view from visual to text.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open any JIRA issue.
# Select text view and add a multiline comment in the comment field.
{panel}
Test line 1
Test line 2
Test line 3
{panel}
# Toggle to visual view. Edit the comment by appending an additional line of text at the end.
{panel}
Test line 1
Test line 2
Test line 3
Test add 1
{panel}
# Toggle to text view.
 
h3. Expected Results
No additional lines, or blank spaces are seen on the comment.

h3. Actual Results
Blank spaces are added to each line preceeding the last added line, except for first line.
{panel}
Test line 1
(_Space_)Test line 2
(_Space_)Test line 3
Test add 1
{panel}

h3. Other Notes
Happens in:
# IE 11.125.16299.0
# Firefox 56.0
# Microsoft Edge 41.16299.15.0

Does not happen in:
Chrome Version 63.0.3239.108 (Official Build) (64-bit)
fields.summary: Switching between visual and text rendering adds "empty spaces" in texts.

fields.description:
h3.  Summary

When using a JQL that returns more than 1000 issues, attempting to navigate to pages until it displays 1001+ (usually page 21 and above) will result in the issue navigator freezing.


h3.  Steps to Reproduce

# Make sure that the JIRA instance has more than 1000 issues.
#  Go to the issue navigator and run a JQL that returns more than 1000 issues.
#  Navigate the pages until it will display issues 1001-xxxx of xxxx where xxxx is the total number of issues in the # projects. This is usually on page 21 or above by default.

 
h3. Expected Results
 The Issue navigator will return issues 1001 and so on in the page.

h3.  Actual Results

The issue navigator will be stuck loading but nothing will load at all. 
 The rest of the JIRA UI will still be responsive.


h3.  Notes

Based on the KB: [How to increase the JIRA search results limit on the issue navigator|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-increase-the-jira-search-results-limit-on-the-issue-navigator-357696242.html], JIRA is supposed to show a message prompt to refine the search but based on testings with vanilla JIRA 7 instances, the message prompts do not appear and the user can proceed to click on pages for issues 1001+.
fields.summary: When attempting to access more than 1000+ results in List view, the issue navigator will be frozen

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When Jira uses an external directory an account may become locked for various reasons. Users may not be unaware of this condition and attempt to login to Jira, only receiving username/password incorrect as an error. Understanding this is desired for security considerations this request is to notify Jira administrators when this happens in order to save time investigating why a certain account is unable to log into Jira. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a password expiration policy for Active Directory
# User account becomes locked due to expired password
# User attempts to log into Jira, receives user/password incorrect prompt

h3. Desired Results
Jira users are notified in some fashion when this occurs ( email, instant message, support tools plugin, etc )

h3. Actual Results
Jira administrators need to inspect logs to determine this cause
fields.summary: Notify Jira administrators when users can't login due to locked accounts in external directories

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Hiding "Attachment" field on the "Field Configuration" screen doesn't affect UI issue view screen. The "Attachments" section is still visible and attached files are accessible.
h3. Environment

All JIRA versions.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As admin or user:
 ## Create an issue in a project
 ## Attach one or more files to the issue (in "Attachments" section)
 # As admin:
 ## go to *Administration > Issues > Field configurations > Configure*  _a specific project configuration_
 ## on a "View Field Configuration" go to "Attachment" field and click "Hide"

h3. Expected Results

For "hidden" field state:
 * The "Attachments" section should not be present on UI issue view screen anymore.

h3. Actual Results

For "hidden" field state:
 * The "Attachments" section is still present on UI issue view screen regardless the Field Configuration settings for the field.

h3. Notes

It looks like it's a usability bug, it confuses the users. Attachments section is presented on a Field Configuration screen like other custom fields, therefore the expected result of Hide/Show options should be aligned (or at least the behavior should be better described there).

At the same time, the REST API works as expected, the "attachment" field value is not present in a REST response (/rest/api/2/issue/issueID call) when the "Attachment" field is in a hidden state.

Also: there's a naming misalignment:
 * "Attachments" on an issue screen view
 * "Attachment" on "Field Configuration" view

h3. Workaround

To hide completely the Attachment section on UI issue view screen you need to modify a permission schema and remove "Create Attachments" (canCreateAttachments) permission for a user role.
fields.summary: Field Configuration: hiding Attachments field doesn't work for issue view screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary

*Background:*
 JIRA maintains a cache of users in Lucene in-memory index. One example of where this is used is user picker fields, including the assignee field.
 * This cache was introduced in JIRA 7.2.0 (see JRASERVER-65126).

Searching for a user in the user picker field causes JIRA to search the cache. Users not present in this cache will not be returned by the search even if they are active users that have the appropriate permissions.

*Problem:*
 JIRA does not add users to the cache when an external directory is enabled. JIRA does add users to the cache during startup but does not add users that are in disabled directories.
 * A directory that is disabled during startup will not work properly when enabled. Users will not be added to the cache and as a result will not appear in user pickers.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install JIRA 7.2.0 or newer
 # Connect to external directory containing users
 # Create sample business project
 # Attempt to assign issue to one of the users in the external directory
 ** Observe: Assignee search works and shows the users
 # Disable directory
 # Restart JIRA
 # Enable directory
 # Attempt to assign issue to one of the users in the external directory
 ** Observe: None of the external users appear in the search
 ** Observe: Typing the entire username and clicking outside of the box will cause issue to be assigned as expected.

h3. Expected Results

Users are cached and user pickers show correct results
h3. Actual Results

Users not cached and as a result users do not appear in user picker after directory is enabled
h3. Notes

*Behavior Notes:*
 * Users are able to log into JIRA. After logging into JIRA they will show in the user picker as expected.
 * User pickers can still be used but the username must be entered as the users cannot be searched for
 * This behavior will also impact JIRA Service Desk user fields, such as the Request Participants field

h3. Workaround

*Recommended workaround:*
* Restart JIRA with external directory enabled

*Alternate workaround:*
* Create new user directory then delete that new directory. 
** The act of deleting a directory will cause related caches to be reset.
* The directory does not need to function. 
** Create new directory, fill out required fields. Click "Save and Test" once to get connection error, click again to save the config. 
** After that disable the new directory then delete it.
fields.summary: LDAP users not added to cache when external directory is enabled

fields.description:
Our designers used to have [^attachment.ext] as an option to choose from in the text editor menu in JIRA when there were attached files in a story. It makes it easy to brief a story with visuals to the development team, especially with a large nr of visuals. This function was not added in the upgrade with the new Rich Text Editor (RTE). Now the option is only manually available . 

When you use this attachment link  !RTE bar - link and attachment section.PNG! now in the RTE bar you get the picture directly shown in the story text: 

!RTE bar.PNG!

With large visuals, it makes the briefing to the development team much harder to read. Our designers want the extra option back that does this:

[^RTE bar.PNG]

Now they need to edit the links manually to get the above result.
fields.summary: RTE - make it possible again to add links to attached visuals using the menu bar

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

When running an incompatible version of *German Language Pack* plugin on JIRA, UPM does not complain that the plugin is incompatible.
h3. *Environment*

JIRA Version : JIRA 7.6.2
Add-On : JIRA German (Germany) Language Pack 
Version: 5.1.4-v2r5334-2012-09-03
Vendor: Atlassian Community
Add-on key: tac.jira.languages.de_DE
h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Install JIRA 7.6.2
 # Install JIRA German (Germany) Language Pack Version: 5.1.4-v2r5334-2012-09-03 Plugin
 (i) Refer to attachment for German (Germany) Language Pack Version: 5.1.4-v2r5334-2012-09-03 JAR file
 # Go to UPM, UPM does not show Instance Health Check plugin is incompatible
 # Change Default Language to Germany and it will show "S<u>t</u>artseite" instead of "Startseite"

h3. *Expected Results*

UPM shows *JIRA German (Germany) Language Pack* plugin is incompatible.
h3. *Actual Results*

UPM does not complain anything.
fields.summary: When incompatible version of German Language Pack plugin installed, UPM didn't state plugin is incompatible
